abstracts.cdata!:
The First Decentralized City Management
            Project for Benin aims to improve the quality of life for
            urban residents, especially the poor, by providing in a
            cost-effective manner more services of better quality to
            residents, especially those in low-income areas, of Cotonou,
            Porto Novo, and Parakou. There are three project components.
            The first not only strengthens municipal management but also
            improves municipal support capacity of line ministries and
            implementing agencies, privatizes urban services, prepares
            historic preservation activities, establishes the local
            information/communication system, and supports reform of the
            urban management regulatory framework. The second component
            supports basic infrastructure by improving the urban road
            network through paving and drainage; funding technical
            studies, civil works supervision, and financing
            technical/financial audits of works; and strengthening small
            and medium enterprises. The third component strengthens
            community participation by building basic neighborhood
            infrastructure, funding community-based activities, and
            supporting community initiatives.
